Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2009 02:59PM bookgirl wrote: I just went through a similar thing. 9mo after the original DX (sept 08) I found a mass near the lumpectomy scar. My Breast Surgeon did a ultra sound and felt it to be a cyst. My one year Mammogram showed nothing but the mass still was there and easy to feel. My BS ordered a MRI.. also clear, but she was uncomfortable since the mass felt like the "bad" one. So I had a biopsy in Nov. It turned out to a Benign tumor. (Hooray!) I had clear margins, chemo, tamox, radiation and the same type tumor removed at the same time as the cancer in almost the same spot. So my thoughts are with you and praying for a big B9 for you!
Posts.Title: Trying really hard not to PANIC!!! thegoodfight thegoodfight

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2011 08:23PM - edited Jul 29, 2011 08:25PM by bookgirl My periods stopped during chemo probably about feb of 09. I'm 52. My hormone levels came back at 8.6 with 8 being the goal for estrogen levels. He is going to test me again in a couple months. I'm a little afraid to make the switch since I have no complaints on Tamoxifen. Thanks again Ladies!
Posts.Title: Tumor marker Scores Should this be of concern bookgirl bookgirl

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2011 06:38PM bookgirl wrote: It is the same Oncologist (I really like and respect him) I'm not sure why the tumor marker test at this point, I think it was just an added bonus when they were checking my hormone levels before switching me from Tamoxifen to ALs. I will be getting a recheck in 3 mos. Thanks for your input.
Posts.Title: Tumor marker Scores Should this be of concern bookgirl bookgirl

Posts.Content: bookgirl wrote: I am about 2.6 years out of diagnosis and treatment but had my first ever tumor marker tests this week. I believe I was 36 or 37 with the limit of normal being 38. I think this test was called ca 27.29 the other test was Cea? and was normal. So being that I am freaked out by any and all tests be they spelling or medial, I was wondering if the high normal is of concern. Or is my anxiety whispering in my ear again. Thanks for all the support ladies! Dx 9/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Tumor marker Scores Should this be of concern bookgirl bookgirl

Posts.Content: Nov 11, 2011 06:40PM - edited Nov 11, 2011 06:40PM by bookgirl Ok here is an update I was retested this week closer to 4 months than 3. Results went to 40.2 up about 1.5 I think. I was high normal but now just above normal. My onc said it could be lab error, or it could be from a hematoma (sp?) in the bad breast. Or it could continue to rise. (But don't worry about) HA I wish...so I get tested again in 3 months. Just had an all clear mammo and MRI with in the last couple months. I guess I'm a little calmer that I expected I would be but was really hoping for a downward trend.

Posts.Title: Why is moving forward so hard? bookgirl bookgirl

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2010 06:08PM bookgirl wrote: I saw my BS every 3 months, now every 6 and hopefully at 2 years out I get to move to 1 year. My BS is wonderful, more aware of changes in the breast and what feels like normal tissue. I saw my OBGYN (one of the best in the area) 2 weeks before my Mammo and he missed the lump. The BS felt it right off. If you can, shop around for a new BS, find someone who makes you feel comfortable, or base your decision on their reputation.  A good BS does SO MUCH more than just cut! Good luck!
Posts.Title: Follow up with surgeon for 5 years? Why? Halah Mantra

Posts.Content: bookgirl wrote: I had a breast infection which responded to antibiotics, but my BS wanted to do a core biopsy to check things out. The results came back with atypical cells. She said this could be from inflammation from the infection, or could be very heavy scar tissue from treatments or of course something else all together. So I am having an excisional biopsy in a couple of weeks. So I was wondering and hoping  someone else has had some thing like this and it was just B9 stuff. I'm tired of being scared! I had moved to my one year with clear Mammo and MRI, but have had 2 biopsy since with # 3 on the way. Thanks listening. Dx 9/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Last Biopsy found atypical cells bookgirl LINDAGARSIDE

Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2009 10:30PM bookgirl wrote: A couple of weeks ago I was in the Acupuncturists waiting room. There was a lady about my age, 50, talking about all the stress and anxiety she was going through when the Dr walked in and commented on my short cute haircut (she had not seen me since pre DX) I laughed and said if she thought it was short now she should have seen me a couple of months ago. The anxious patient said "oh you have cancer! and I though I had problems" then she burst into tears and I could hear her howling all the way down the hall. It made me realize she thought of herself as the man with no shoes and I had become the man with no feet! CRAP!
Posts.Title: Today was a hard day...... Pure charmd

For anyone sore from constipation try Witch Hazel sprayed right from the bottle! REALLY soothing. My hair is coming out, sort of like my dogs shedding in warm weather. My daughter said at least we know the chemo is working! My next treatment is Jan 26. Prayers are with you all!

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2010 04:55AM - edited Jun 15, 2010 04:57AM by bookgirl Just wanted to let you know that my thoughts are with you. My daughter's teacher found out she had cancer while pregnant a few years ago. She underwent Chemo during the pregnancy, they delivered the baby (a healthy little girl) then she did radiation. Last I saw her she was back teaching and looked wonderful. I find that it is helpful to know that someone has walked the path before me, hope this helped a little. All the best to you, God bless.

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2009 08:26PM bookgirl wrote: The hair thing is kind of fascinating, sad and amusing at the same time...Seems like a new hair style every 20 minutes. This morning I looked like the bad guy from The Incredibles...this evening sort of like a condor chick. I think I will watch it disappear naturally. My 15 year old decided to learn cook while I'm in the shedding faze. I have a few scarves but haven't figured out how to tie them yet.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo January 2009? lisalisa ktym

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2011 03:46PM - edited Jan 21, 2011 03:47PM by bookgirl I'm two years out and see my BS every 6 mo. same with my Onc. Started off every 3 mo. I love them both but I know the BS is very aggressive and pro active. Her check ups are more intense and she knows my breasts inside and out (Ha-Ha) I find the Onc also relies on her judgments. He on the other hand makes the calls on my meds and other cancer related issues. If your comfortable and have the resources to see a variety of good Drs I say go for it. It's hard enough to find peace of mind as it is!
Posts.Title: How Long to Follow Up with BS? tpcjkk bookgirl

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2009 05:59PM - edited Nov 6, 2009 06:00PM by bookgirl Hello everybody! I just am finishing my 1 year checks. Mammo came back clear but BS wants a MRI (Had it today) She says I am so lumpy and dense she would be more comfortable. I of course am a nervous wreck! The waiting doesn't seem to get any easier! Knowing there are others out there feeling the same things I do has been a blessing! Thanks!

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2011 09:52PM bookgirl wrote: LizM, you sound exactly like me! The idea of any testing, be it blood or even peeing in a jar FREAKS me out. If there is some result, (usually human error, or maybe a sick sense of humor of the cosmos), that can be screwed up on a test it will be mine. I use a mix of attempts to relieve the anxiety. Acupuncture helps, Chinese herbs, western meds and lots of prayer! All the best to you!
Posts.Title: Panic at ANYTHING medical related bookgirl frustratedrg

Posts.Content: bookgirl wrote: Does anyone else freak at the thought of any thing even slightly medial related. I am two years out from getting the big C word, but scare myself before any Dr appointment to the point where I have to pull out the atavan. I worry about minor things with my kids health, regular medical exams for my DH, and of course those 6 month checks with the ONC and the BS. Do you think this par for the course? How do some of you nervous gals deal when this flares up? Dx 9/2008, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
